measured_by: equivalized monthly household net income (OECD scale)
justification: "Objective economic situation was measured as a monthly household net income transformed in accordance with a slightly revised OECD modification scale [81]."

measured_by: 6-item financial literacy questionnaire (3 basic + 3 advanced items)
justification: "In the first data collection, 3 basic and 3 advanced questions [84] for assessing financial literacy were used."

measured_by: Staircase model of time and risk preferences
justification: "Time-discounting was assessed via the Staircase model proposed [78]."
"Due to the non-normal distribution ... we settled for including 27-Item Monetary Choice Questionnaire [85,86] as an additional measure in the second data collection."

measured_by: Falk et al. risk preference questionnaire
justification: "Risk preference in case of reward ... were assessed using the model by Falk et al. [78]."

measured_by: modified Falk et al. risk preference questionnaire (loss version)
justification: "Risk preference in case of ... loss were, too, assessed using the model by Falk et al. [78], however, ... we modified the measure in which loss was involved by reducing the presented amount of money."

measured_by: MacArthur Scale of Subjective Social Status
justification: "Subjective poverty was measured by 3 indicators: (1) Subjective perception of socioeconomic status (The MacArthur scale of subjective social status; [82,83])."
"Subjective poverty was measured by ... (2) The mean score of the created 6-item 5-point scale of wealth satisfaction."
"Subjective poverty was measured by ... (3) own perception of poverty/wealth (You consider yourself as: 1 = poor; ... 9 = rich)."
